We want to make sure all of our patients are safe while at the health center. Please call as soon as possible to make your appointment.
Jan Morrow

Return to School:
Our school and community was impacted in an unprecedented way by the COVID-19 pandemic last spring. On March 17, the district made a decision to close school for the safety of our staff and students. We realize this closure negatively affected the education of students. We believe in-person schooling is vital in providing a quality education and we are preparing to return to school on August 24.

The district is aware this public health crisis has not ended. Adults, particularly those who are older and those with underlying health conditions are at increased risk of serious illness from COVID-19. The district will provide the safest learning environment possible and will do our best to implement guidelines to help reduce the spread of this virus. Guidelines and recommendations will be posted by August 3.

Groups of students were given an envelope full of slips of paper with names of items on them. As a group they had to separate their piles into "needs", "wants", and any they couldn't agree on in the middle. Surprisingly, every group had very different lists, groupings, and what they considered "middle ground". Listening to them debate the needs and wants was extremely interesting! They had some very solid reasonings and debated with their teammates in a positive and mannerly fashion. Afterwards they were posed a few questions regarding the subject. We have several students here at DMS with strong logical thinking skills! If you were to ask them about the what's and why's I think you'd be very impressed by what they have to say. Just another "life skill not wife skill" they're learning in FACS class!

Mrs. Brewer's 7th grade Medical Detective PLTW students, discover how healthcare professionals act as medical detectives to identify, treat, and prevent illness in their patients. Students collect and interpret vital signs to evaluate patient health, explore different infectious disease agents, and design and conduct experiments to test the effectiveness of antibiotics on bacteria.
Students learned about:
1. What can patient signs and symptoms tell us about what‚Äôs happening in the human body?
2. How do medical detectives investigate their cases?
3. What does effective teamwork look like?
